lines.text: He says his name is Charles, but he looks to me like a pool parlor dude.
How did you find me here?
I saw a great group of men standing around a table. I knew there was only one woman in the world who could attract men like that. A woman with a lot of money.

[Reading phone messages]
Here's another one of those "Call Long Island Operator #15." Don't you think you ought to call her?
Certainly not; she knows better than that! I told her I was bringing the wife along this time.
I don't know why I always take it for granted that you're kidding.
I got rid of all those reporters.
What did you tell them?
We're out of scotch.
What a gruesome idea.
What's the idea of the kid?
Well, we have a dog, and he was lonesome. That was the idea, wasn't it, Mummy?
It wasn't his fault. Nick smells like a dog.
Oh, we had a lovely trip. Nick was sober in Kansas City.
Nick sent me up the river.
It's nice you don't feel bad about it.
Why should I? Gee! It took a genius to outsmart me.
You wanna touch me?
Really, Creeps, you shouldn't run him down like that.
We're going to have to shoot that mutt. We'll never find him like this.
Wait a minute. He's not going to come running up to a lot of strange men with lights. What do you think he is? A moth?
You should see some of the monkeys I see, and the fathers are taking bows.

He wants a lot of money. And when you won't give it to him, he says you won't be pigheaded, because he dreamed twice about your dying. And the third time he dreams things, they come true. Now, what do you think?
I wouldn't think I have to hurry up my dying on his account.
You won't be alone long. Wait till the news of your 5 millions hits the front pages. You'll find you've got relatives all over the world.
[last lines]
Let's sit down.
Sit down? What for?
Just to get a little rest after our quiet weekend in the country.

I'm not walking out, I'm running out... During this quiet little weekend in the country, my family's been threatened, I've had a knife thrown at me, I've been shot at, and I've been suspected of murder... I'm going back to New York!
We don't want no hot tot!
[to their waiter]
Two Bacardis.
The same.
The man means to kill me, and I'm asking Mr. Charles not to let him do it. That's simple enough, isn't it? Even for Mr. Charles.
No.
